required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inhaled Sedation Using the Anesthetic-conserving Device ( ANACONDA) in Prehospital Emergency Medecine.
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of Isoflurane Sedation Using an Anesthetic-conserving Device in Prehospital Emergency Medicine: A Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Achieving the optimal sedation level for patient management is not always possible using our standard intravenous medications in Pre-hospital Emergency medicine. Inhaled sedation is possible with the Anesthetic-conserving device with a standard respirator.
The pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics of halogenated agents allow deep sedation quickly after absorption.
The feasibility of inhaled sedation has never been studied in hospital.

detailed_description.textblock: Retrospecive clinical monocentric study with sedated ventilated patients with isoflurane with the AnaCondaÂ® system out of hospital.

primary_outcome.description: depth of sedation (measured by the Ramsay Score) 10 minutes from start of the sedation and at stop of pre hospital sedation. The Ramsay score ranges level of sedation from 1(patient anxious ,agitated,restless) to 6 (patient exhibits no response).

secondary_outcome.measure: hemodynamic tolerance of patients during isoflurane sedation
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of heart rate (heart beats per minute) before isoflurane start and 10 minutes from start of the sedation and at stop of pre hospital sedation

secondary_outcome.measure: hemodynamic tolerance of patients during isoflurane sedation
secondary_outcome.description: comparison of medium blood pressure (mmHg) before isoflurane start and 10 minutes from start of the sedation and at stop of pre hospital sedation

study_pop.textblock: patients who were sedated by isoflurane with Anesthetic-conserving device in pre-hospital by the emergency teams of SAMU 29

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient sedated by isoflurane with Anesthetic-conserving device in pre-hospital
- Major patient
- not opposed to participating
Exclusion Criteria:
- Adults Under legal protection
- patient refusal to participate in study

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected data that underlie result in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available beginning three months and ending five years following the publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access requests will be rewiewed by internal committee of Brest UH. Requestors will be required to sign and complete a data access agreement.
